department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: 'Famille-rose' bowl; four line inscription at side of bowl with 3 red stamps; white ground, two intertwining branches with pink and yellow blossoms; has own storage box
medium:
Falangcai ware
Porcelain with famille-rose enamel decoration
text: This stunning, beautifully designed and flawlessly executed bowl belongs to a small group of <I>famille-rose<I> wares that were decorated at a special workshop inside the Forbidden City in Beijing. The imperial kilns at Jingdezhen manufactured very thinly potted, pure white vessels with a specially refined glaze to best display the enamel decorations, which were then painted at the palace by the finest artisans available. At first, these painters used enamels (known as <I>falangcai<I>) that were imported from Europe. Later, the enamels were produced at Jingdezhen from locally available materials.
title: Bowl with Flowering Prunus and Poem Design
